document_data.name: Bard Dance
document_data.mainbody: '''''Bard Dance''''' was popular upbeat foot-tapper song in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], often performed with and without lyrics.
document_data.Contents:
{{quote|''Kick your heels together, feet off the ground,
Hands in the air and twirl around!
Step once to the left and twice to the right,
Then four times ahead, carefree as a sprite!
Take a long bow, as deep as you can,
And start the whole dance all over again!''|''Bard Dance'' lyrics}}
document_data.History: By the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, performances of ''Bard Dance'' were common across the streets of [[Baldur's Gate]] and the [[Western Heartlands]], along the shores of the [[Chionthar Valley]]. [[Bard]]s and [[minstrel]]s were sure to sing or play the melody and swiftly attract attention of the crowds.
